**Silver dragon scales** are a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Silver dragon scales are not randomly generated, though they can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").

A [silver dragon](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon") that leaves a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") behind on death (i.e. always, unless killed by [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration")) have a 1⁄3 chance of leaving behind dragon scales, while a dragon revived by the [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning") or [spell of turn undead](/wiki/Spell_of_turn_undead "Spell of turn undead") only has a 1⁄20 chance to leave behind scales.[\[1\]](#cite_note-scalegen-1) Silver dragon scales dropped this way are always generated +0 and uncursed.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, silver dragon scales confer 3 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"). Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn silver dragon scales will convert them into [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail"), with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing silver dragon scales will turn the wearer into a silver dragon, and doing so while wearing the scale mail will additionally revert them to scales.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scales#Strategy](/wiki/Dragon_scales#Strategy "Dragon scales")*

Silver dragon scales are one of the two most coveted types, with the other being [gray dragon scales](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scales "Gray dragon scales"), and both are used to create what is generally considered the best form of body armor available. Most characters will prefer either type for their dragon mail, though there are other instances where another color may be sought out - for details on what makes silver the most preferable color for a given character, see the [strategy section](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail#Strategy "Silver dragon scale mail") of the article on silver dragon scale mail.

## History

Silver dragon scales first appear in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6"), and make their vanilla debut in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Some variants also give silver dragon scales additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of gray dragon scale armor - due to already being a powerful item, they may be less commonly given properties compared to other colors. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make other colors more worthwhile.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") characters can use their [tinker](/wiki/Tinker "Tinker") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") to turn various [cloaks](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") into a cloak of magic resistance with enough time, food and patience, which may make silver dragon scales more favorable for them to seek out.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), silver dragon scales are one of the few sets of dragon scales to not confer additional properties while worn.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon.

Silver dragon scales are effectively replaced by **reflecting dragon scales**, which confer only 1 base AC like all dragon scales in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn silver dragon scales do not confer any additional properties, but its reflection additionally affects dragon breath as in *NetHack*, which most sources of reflection in dNetHack cannot do. Dragon scales also weigh 150 aum.

The [Platinum Dragon Plate](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Platinum_Dragon_Plate "DNetHack artifacts") is an unaligned [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") set of silver dragon scale mail that can be [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") to return them to scale form (e.g. to form them into a scale shield).

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn silver dragon scales confer no additional properties, but provide reflection that affects dragonbreath and rays from wands [used at Skilled or higher](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch"). They also weigh 300 aum like all dragon scales in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).
